description: This is a spent, rimmed casing from a discharged .30-30 Winchester Centre Fire cartridge.

This is a centre-fired, .30-calibre Winchester cartridge loaded with a 160-grain lead flat-nosed bullet, backed by 30 grains of smokeless gunpowder.  Rimmed, bottle-necked, and a pioneer of American small-bore hunting rounds, the .30-30 is a popular chambering for contemporary lever-action rifles, and many an unfortunate dear has been brought to the dinner table at the beck of this cartridge.  The .30 Winchester’s accurate nature makes it beloved by many huntsmen, in spite of its relatively modest range.

This is a hand-reloaded .30-calibre Winchester cartridge loaded with a 160-grain lead bullet.  Rimmed, bottle-necked, and a pioneer of American small-bore hunting rounds, the.30-30 is a popular chambering for contemporary lever-action rifles, and many an unfortunate dear has been brought to the dinner table at the beck of this cartridge.  The .30 Winchester’s accurate nature makes it beloved by many huntsmen, in spite of its relatively modest range.  This particular round has been home reloaded to looser tolerances than factory-checked munitions.

A return to form, this is a hand-reloaded .30-calibre Winchester cartridge loaded with a flat-nosed lead bullet, propelled by black gunpowder.  Rimmed, bottle-necked, and, normally, a pioneer of American small-bore smokeless hunting rounds, the .30-30 is a popular chambering for contemporary lever-action rifles, and many an unfortunate dear has been brought to the dinner table at the beck of this cartridge.  While ordinarily more accurate than older hunting cartridges, this particular round has been loaded with black powder, leading to decreased chamber pressures, lower velocities, and muzzle smoke.
